key_title: Key to the subspecies of Stylidium armeria

source.author: Best, R.J; Francis, D.E.; Walsh, N.G.
source.title: A new subspecies of Stylidium armeria (Stylidiaceae) from the Macedon Range, Victoria
source.citation: From: Best, R.J; Francis, D.E.; Walsh, N.G. (2009). A new subspecies of Stylidium armeria (Stylidiaceae) from the Macedon Range, Victoria. Muelleria 27:174-178.

leads.lead_text: Leaf glabrous on both surfaces or, rarely, with a few, widely spaced glandular hairs on margins and/or abaxial midrib, and these usually present only on juvenile plants; longest leaf (10–)12–40 cm long, leaf length/width ratio mostly greater than 18; flowers mostly deep pink to magenta (rarely pale pink or white); widespread in diverse habitats from the coast to the subalps

Leaf pilose with eglandular and glandular hairs on both surfaces and margins; longest leaf 11 cm long or less, leaf length/width ratio less than 18; flowers white to pale pink; dry, shaly soils in foothills of central Victoria (Macedon Ranges and Pyrete Range)
